page.title: 14Aerial View (Contd.)
page.content: The playground looks desolate and bare now that the children have gone. There are loads of houses in Ynystawe. They all lead up to Clydach. Some are very old and their gardens are untidy. Some houses have recently been built and look like boxes in a row. There are washing lines in the gardens and mothers putting washing on the line, staggering up the garden with bundles of washing, like snails carrying their houses. I can see where the stack used to be. Bricks remain scattered on wasteland from the time when the stack was blown up. I can see Ynystawe Park . The roundabout looks like a large cake. This is how I see Ynystawe from the sky. The birds are very lucky. I wish I was a bird.
